• Optional

parameters.name: height
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

height of the square. If unset, it defaults to zero

functions.shortDoc: An empty square that adds whitespace to the layout. If at least one of the dimensions is set, the square will have a fixed size. If both dimensions are unset, a blank character is used, which can be useful for spacing and adding line breaks.

functions.name: todo

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:

content to show in the box

functions.shortDoc: Creates a to do box, to mark content that needs to be done later, and logs it. The title is localized according to the current locale (doclang), or English as a fallback.

functions.name: landscape

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

content to clip

functions.shortDoc:
Transposes content to landscape orientation by rotating it 90 degrees counter-clockwise. This is useful for wide content, such as diagrams, that does not fit in the normal page orientation.
This feature is experimental and may render inconsistently.

functions.name: html

parameters.name: content
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

raw HTML content to inject

functions.shortDoc: Creates an HTML element, which is rendered as-is without any additional processing or escaping, as long as the rendering target supports HTML.

functions.name: cssproperties

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: a map of CSS property names and their values

functions.shortDoc: Overrides the value of Quarkdown CSS properties. Each entry corresponds to a Quarkdown CSS property name and its value. The names will be prefixed with --qd- to match the Quarkdown CSS variable naming convention.

functions.name: css

parameters.name: content
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

raw CSS content to inject

functions.shortDoc: Creates a <style> HTML element with the provided CSS content. The content is wrapped in a <style> tag and rendered as-is, without any additional processing or escaping, as long as the rendering target supports HTML.

functions.name: Text
functions.shortDoc: Text stdlib module exporter. This module handles text formatting.

functions.name: Mermaid
functions.shortDoc: Mermaid stdlib module exporter. This module handles generation of Mermaid diagrams.

functions.name: Flow
functions.shortDoc: Flow stdlib module exporter. This module handles the control flow and other statements.

functions.name: Logical
functions.shortDoc: Logical stdlib module exporter.

functions.name: Document
functions.shortDoc: Document stdlib module exporter. This module handles document information and details.

functions.name: values
functions.shortDoc: Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they're declared.

functions.name: apply

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: the sequence to sort

parameters.name: by
parameters.description: the function to extract the sorting key from each item

functions.shortDoc: Applies the sorting order to a sequence of items.

functions.name: entries
functions.shortDoc: Returns a representation of an immutable list of all enum entries, in the order they're declared.

functions.name: valueOf
functions.shortDoc: Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)

functions.name: Collection
functions.shortDoc: Collection stdlib module exporter. This module handles iterable collections.

functions.name: Library
functions.shortDoc: Library stdlib module exporter. This module handles loaded libraries and their functions.

functions.name: Optionality
functions.shortDoc: Optionality stdlib module exporter. This module handles None values to express optional values.

functions.name: Bibliography
functions.shortDoc: Bibliography stdlib module exporter. This module handles bibliographies and citations.

functions.name: values
functions.shortDoc: Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they're declared.

functions.name: entries
functions.shortDoc: Returns a representation of an immutable list of all enum entries, in the order they're declared.

functions.name: valueOf
functions.shortDoc: Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)

functions.name: Logger
functions.shortDoc: Logger stdlib module exporter. This module contains logging utility.

functions.name: String
functions.shortDoc: String stdlib module exporter. This module handles string manipulation.

functions.name: Slides
functions.shortDoc: Slides stdlib module exporter. This module handles slides properties.

functions.name: NOT_FOUND
functions.shortDoc: Fallback value for non-existent elements in collections, dictionaries, and more.

functions.name: Dictionary
functions.shortDoc: Dictionary stdlib module exporter. This module handles map-like dictionaries.

functions.name: TableComputation
functions.shortDoc: TableComputation stdlib module exporter. This module provides advanced functionality for tables, enhancing their capabilities beyond basic data representation. It adds dynamic operations like sorting, filtering, calculations.

functions.name: Layout
functions.shortDoc: Layout stdlib module exporter. This module handles position and shape of an element.

functions.name: Localization
functions.shortDoc: Localization stdlib module exporter. This module handles localization-related features.

functions.name: Data
functions.shortDoc: Data stdlib module exporter. This module handles content fetched from external resources.

functions.name: Injection
functions.shortDoc: Injection stdlib module exporter. This module handles code injection of different languages.

functions.name: Ecosystem
functions.shortDoc: Ecosystem stdlib module exporter. This module handles interaction between Quarkdown sources.

functions.name: Math
functions.shortDoc: Math stdlib module exporter.

whether to show line numbers

parameters.name: focus
parameters.description:
• Optional

range of lines to focus on. No lines are focused if unset. Supports open ranges. Note: HTML rendering requires linenumbers to be enabled.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

code content

functions.shortDoc: Creates a code block. Contrary to its standard Markdown implementation with backtick/tilde fences, this function accepts function calls within its code argument, hence it can be used - for example - in combination with read to load code from file.

functions.name: loremipsum
functions.shortDoc: a fixed Lorem Ipsum text.

functions.name: br
functions.shortDoc: Creates a line break. In standard Markdown, this is also achievable with two spaces at the end of a line, but this function provides a more explicit and unambiguous way to insert a line break.

functions.name: uppercase

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: string to convert

functions.shortDoc: Converts a string to uppercase. Example: Hello, World! -> `HELLO, WORLD!

functions.name: capitalize

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: string to capitalize

functions.shortDoc: Capitalizes the first character of a string. Example: hello, world! ->Hello, world!

functions.name: string

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: string to wrap

functions.shortDoc: Creates a string. If value is delimited by " characters, they are removed and the wrapped string is not trimmed, as opposed to what usually happens through Quarkdown's parser. Example: " Hello, World! " ->Hello, World!

functions.name: lowercase

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: string to convert

functions.shortDoc: Converts a string to lowercase. Example: Hello, World! ->hello, world!

functions.name: isnotempty

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: string to check

functions.shortDoc: Checks if a string is not empty.

second string

parameters.name: if
parameters.description:

  • Likely named

if true, concatenates a and b

functions.shortDoc: Concatenates two strings if a condition is met. Example: Hello, and World! ->Hello, World!

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: string to check

parameters.name: content

content to show/hide

functions.shortDoc: Creates an element that, when used in a slides document, shows its content when the user attempts to go to the next slide. Multiple fragments in the same slide are shown in order on distinct user interactions.

functions.name: tablecolumn

parameters.description: index of the column (starting from 1)

parameters.name: of

table to extract the column from

functions.shortDoc: Retrieves a specific column from a table as a collection of values.

functions.name: tablecompute

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: index of the column (starting from 1)

parameters.name: compute
parameters.description: a lambda function that returns any value, which is the output of the computation. The lambda accepts a single argument, which is the ordered collection of cell values of the column.

functions.shortDoc: Performs a computation on a specific column of a table, appending the result to a new cell in the bottom.

functions.name: tablefilter

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: index of the column (starting from 1)

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: a lambda function that returns a boolean value. When true, the rows is to be kept. The lambda accepts a single argument, which is the cell value of the column.

functions.shortDoc: Filters the rows of a table based on a boolean expression on a specific column.

functions.name: tablecolumns

  • Likely named

table to extract the columns from

functions.shortDoc: Retrieves all columns from a table as a collection of collections.

  • Likely named

table to sort

functions.shortDoc: Sorts a table based on the values of a column.

functions.name: error

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: error message

functions.shortDoc: Throws an Exception with the given message. The result depends on the pipeline's error handler. By default, the message is logged (error level) to the standard output and an error box is rendered on the document. If the program is run on strict mode, the stack trace is printed and the process will be stopped.

functions.shortDoc: sine of the angle x given in radians.

functions.name: abs

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: number to get the absolute value of

functions.shortDoc: the absolute value of x

functions.name: pi
functions.shortDoc: the value of pi

functions.name: range
functions.shortDoc: Creates a range of numbers, which can also be iterated through. The behavior of an open range is delegated to the consumer. For instance, using a left-open range with foreach will make the loop start from 1. The difference between this function and the built-in .. operator is that the latter does not allow for dynamic evaluation, hence both ends must be literals. This function allows evaluating ends dynamically: for instance, .range from:{1} to:{.sum {1} {2}}. Floating-point numbers are truncated to integers.

functions.name: tan
functions.shortDoc: tangent of the angle x given in radians.

functions.name: multiply
functions.shortDoc: arithmetic floating-point multiplication of a and by

functions.name: logn

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: number to get the natural logarithm of

functions.shortDoc: the natural logarithm of x

functions.name: divide
functions.shortDoc: arithmetic floating-point division of a and by

functions.name: truncate

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: number to truncate

parameters.name: decimals
parameters.description:
• Likely named

maximum number of decimal places to keep. Must be a non-negative number

functions.shortDoc: Truncates a floating-point number to a specified number of decimal places.

functions.name: round

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: number to round

functions.shortDoc: Rounds a floating-point number to the nearest integer.

functions.name: rem
functions.shortDoc: remainder of the arithmetic floating-point division of a and b

functions.name: sqrt

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: number to get the square root of

functions.shortDoc: the square root of x

functions.name: sum
functions.shortDoc: arithmetic floating-point sum of a and b

functions.name: iseven
functions.shortDoc: whether the integer value of x is an even number

functions.name: function

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: name of the function

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

content of the function. Function parameters must be explicit lambda parameters

functions.shortDoc: Defines a custom function that can be called later in the document. The amount of parameters (thus of expected arguments) is determined by the amount of explicit lambda parameters. Arguments can be accessed as a function call via their names. The return type of the function is dynamic, hence it can be used as an input of various types for other function calls.

functions.name: let

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to use as a temporary variable

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

content to evaluate with the temporary variable. Accepts 1 parameter (value itself)

functions.shortDoc: Defines a temporary variable that can be used in the lambda body. Example:

functions.name: foreach

parameters.name: iterable
parameters.description: collection to iterate

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

content, output of each iteration. Accepts 1 parameter (the current element).

functions.shortDoc: Repeats content for each element of an iterable collection. The current element can be accessed via the lambda argument, which may be either explicit or implicit.

functions.name: var

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: name of the variable

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to assign

functions.shortDoc: Defines a new variable or overwrites an existing one. Variables can be referenced just like functions, via .variablename.

functions.name: if

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: whether the content should be added to the document

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

content to append if condition is verified. Accepts 0 parameters.

functions.shortDoc: the evaluation of body if condition is true, nothing otherwise

functions.name: repeat

parameters.name: times
parameters.description: amount of times to repeat the content

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

content, output of each iteration. Accepts 1 parameter (the current element).

functions.shortDoc: Repeats content N times. The current index (starting from 1) can be accessed via the lambda argument. This is shorthand for foreach {..N} {body}.

functions.name: ifnot

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: whether the content should be added to the document

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

content to append if condition is not verified. Accepts 0 parameters.

functions.shortDoc: body if condition is false, nothing otherwise

functions.name: node
functions.shortDoc: Creates a null invisible node that forces the expression it lies in to be evaluated as Markdown content. This is a workaround that can be used at the beginning of lambda blocks (e.g. in a .function, .if or .foreach call) in case the visible output does not match the expected one.

functions.name: dictionary

parameters.name: dictionary
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

dictionary to initialize

functions.shortDoc: Makes the initialization of a dictionary explicit, to avoid ambiguity with collection initialization.

functions.name: get

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: key to get the value of

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

dictionary to get the value from

parameters.name: orelse
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

value to return if the key is not present. If unset, false is returned.

functions.shortDoc: value corresponding to the given key, or NOT_FOUND if the key is not present

functions.name: docauthor

parameters.name: author
parameters.description:
• Optional

(optional) author to assign to the document

functions.shortDoc: If author is not null, it sets the document author to its value. If it's null, the current document author is returned.

functions.name: doclang

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description:
• Optional

(optional) case-insensitive, either a locale tag (e.g. en, en-US, it, fr-CA) or an English name of a locale (e.g. English, English (United States), Italian, French (Canada)) to assign to the document

functions.shortDoc: If locale is not null, it sets the document locale to its value. If it's null, the localized name of the current document locale is returned.

functions.name: footer
functions.shortDoc: Displays text content on the bottom center of each page of a document. Shortcut for pagemargin with PageMarginPosition.BOTTOM_CENTER as its position.

functions.name: numbering

parameters.name: formats
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

map of numbering formats for different element types. Built-in keys are:

  • headings, used for headings (titles) and tableofcontents entries;

  • figures, used for captioned images;

  • tables, used for captioned tables;

  • footnotes, used for footnotes and references to them. Any other key can be addressed by custom elements (see numbered).

functions.shortDoc: Sets the global numbering format across the document. Numbering is applied to elements that support it, such as headings and figures.

functions.name: nonumbering
functions.shortDoc: Disables numbering across the document, in case a default numbering is set.

functions.name: doctype

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
• Optional

(optional) type to assign to the document

Values

  • plain
  • paged
  • slides

functions.shortDoc: If type is not null, it sets the document type to its value. The document type affects its final output style. If it's null, the name of the current document type is returned.

functions.name: noautopagebreak
functions.shortDoc: Disables automatic page breaks when a heading is found.

functions.name: pagemargin

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
• Optional

position of the content within the page

Values

  • topleftcorner
  • topleft
  • topcenter
  • topright
  • toprightcorner
  • righttop
  • rightmiddle
  • rightbottom
  • bottomrightcorner
  • bottomright
  • bottomcenter
  • bottomleft
  • bottomleftcorner
  • leftbottom
  • leftmiddle
  • lefttop

parameters.name: content
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

content to be displayed on each page

functions.shortDoc: Displays text content on each page of a document.

functions.name: texmacro

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: name of the macro

parameters.name: macro
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

TeX code

functions.shortDoc: Creates a new global TeX macro that can be accessed within math blocks.

functions.name: marker

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: name of the marker

functions.shortDoc: Creates an invisible marker that points to a specific location in the document, and can be referenced by other elements as would happen with a regular heading. It can be particularly useful when using a table of contents.

functions.name: autopagebreak

parameters.name: maxdepth
parameters.description:
• Likely named

heading depth to force page breaks for (positive only).

functions.shortDoc: Sets a new automatic page break threshold when a heading is found: if a heading's depth value (the amount of leading #s) is equals or less than maxdepth, a page break is forced before the heading.

functions.name: currentpage
functions.shortDoc: Displays the index (beginning from 1) of the page this element lies in. In case the current document type does not support page counting (e.g. plain document), a placeholder is used.

functions.name: paragraphstyle

parameters.name: lineheight
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

height of each line, multiplied by the font size

parameters.name: letterspacing
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

whitespace between letters, multiplied by the font size

parameters.name: spacing
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

whitespace between paragraphs, multiplied by the font size. This also minorly affects whitespace around lists and between list items

parameters.name: indent
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

whitespace at the start of each paragraph, multiplied by the font size. LaTeX's policy is used: indenting the first line of paragraphs, except the first one and aligned ones

functions.shortDoc: Sets the global style of paragraphs in the document. If a value is unset, the default value supplied by the underlying renderer is used.

functions.name: docauthors

parameters.name: authors
parameters.description:
• Optional

(optional) authors to assign to the document. Each dictionary entry contains the author's name associated with a nested dictionary of additional information.

functions.shortDoc: If authors is not null, it sets the document authors to its value. If it's null, the current document authors are returned.

functions.name: docname

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
• Optional

(optional) name to assign to the document

functions.shortDoc: If name is not null, it sets the document name to its value. If it's null, the current document name is returned.

functions.name: captionposition

parameters.name: default
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

the default position for all captions. Defaults to CaptionPosition.BOTTOM

Values

  • top
  • bottom

parameters.name: figures
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

caption position for figures. If set, overrides default for figures.

Values

  • top
  • bottom

parameters.name: tables
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

caption position for tables. If set, overrides default for tables.

Values

  • top
  • bottom

functions.shortDoc: Sets the position of captions, relative to the content they describe.

functions.name: totalpages
functions.shortDoc: Displays the total amount of pages in the document. In case the current document type does not support page counting (e.g. plain document), a placeholder is used.

functions.name: pageformat

parameters.name: size
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

standard size format of each page (overridden by width and height)

Values

  • a0
  • a1
  • a2
  • a3
  • a4
  • a5
  • a6
  • a7
  • a8
  • a9
  • a10
  • b0
  • b1
  • b2
  • b3
  • b4
  • b5
  • letter
  • legal
  • ledger

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

orientation of each page. If not specified, the preferred orientation of the document type is used. Does not take effect if size is not specified.

Values

  • portrait
  • landscape

parameters.name: width
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

width of each page

parameters.name: height
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

height of each page

parameters.name: margin
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

blank space around the content of each page. Not supported in slides documents

parameters.name: bordertop
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

border width of the top content area of each page

parameters.name: borderright
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

border width of the right content area of each page

parameters.name: borderbottom
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

border width of the bottom content area of each page

parameters.name: borderleft
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

border width of the left content area of each page

parameters.name: bordercolor
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

color of the border around the content area of each page

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

positive number of columns on each page. If set and greater than 1, the layout becomes multi-column. If < 1, the value is discarded

parameters.name: alignment
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

text alignment of the content on each page

Values

  • start
  • center
  • end
  • justify

functions.shortDoc: Sets the format of the document. If a value is unset, the default value supplied by the underlying renderer is used.

functions.name: font

parameters.name: main
parameters.description:
• Optional

main font family of content on each page

parameters.name: heading
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

font family of headings on each page

parameters.name: code
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

font family of code blocks and code spans on each page

parameters.name: size
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

font size of the text on each page

functions.shortDoc: Updates the global font configuration of the document.

functions.name: theme

parameters.name: color
parameters.description:
• Optional

(optional) color scheme to assign (searched in resources/render/theme/color)

parameters.name: layout
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

(optional) layout format to assign (searched in resources/render/theme/layout)

functions.shortDoc: Sets the global document theme.

functions.name: tableofcontents

parameters.name: title
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

title of the table of contents. If unset, the default localized title is used

parameters.name: maxdepth
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

maximum depth of the table of contents

parameters.name: focus
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

if set, adds focus to the item of the table of contents with the same text content as this argument. Inline style (strong, emphasis, etc.) is ignored when comparing the text content.

functions.shortDoc: Generates a table of contents for the document.

functions.name: equals
functions.shortDoc: whether a and to have equal content

functions.name: not
functions.shortDoc: the negation of value

functions.name: isgreater

parameters.name: orequals
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

whether the comparison should be 'greater or equals' instead

functions.shortDoc: whether a > b (or >= if orequals is true)

functions.name: islower

parameters.name: orequals
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

whether the comparison should be 'lower or equals' instead

functions.shortDoc: whether a < b (or <= if orequals is true)

functions.name: localization

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
• Likely named

name of the localization table. Must be unique if merge is false.

parameters.name: merge
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

if enabled and a table with the same name already exists, the two tables will be merged, with higher priority to the new one

parameters.name: contents
parameters.description:
• Likely a body argument

dictionary of locales and their key-value entries

functions.shortDoc: Defines and registers a new localization table, whose entries are key-value pairs for each locale and defined by a Markdown dictionary.

functions.name: localize

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: key to localize, in the format tableName:keyName

parameters.name: separator
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

separator between the table name and the key name. Defaults to :

functions.shortDoc: Localizes a key from a pre-existing localization table (defined via localization).

functions.name: ifpresent

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to check

parameters.name: mapping
parameters.description: lambda to execute if value is not none. It should accept one argument, which is value, and return a value.

functions.shortDoc: Maps value to the result of mapping.

functions.name: none
functions.shortDoc: a value which represents nothing

functions.name: takeif

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to check

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: condition to check, which accepts one argument (value) and returns a boolean

functions.shortDoc: Keeps value if condition is true, otherwise returns none.

functions.name: isnone

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to check

functions.shortDoc: whether value represents a none value

functions.name: otherwise

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to check

parameters.name: fallback
parameters.description:
• Likely named

value to return if value is none

functions.shortDoc: value if it is not none, fallback otherwise

functions.name: size

parameters.name: of
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to get the size of

functions.shortDoc: the non-negative size of the collection

functions.name: last

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to get the last element from

functions.shortDoc: last element of the collection, or NOT_FOUND if the collection is empty

functions.name: second

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to get the second element from

functions.shortDoc: second element of the collection, or NOT_FOUND if the collection has less than 2 elements

functions.name: distinct

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to get the distinct elements from

functions.shortDoc: a new collection with the same elements as the original, without duplicates

functions.name: sorted

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to sort

parameters.name: by
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

optional sorting function. If not provided, the collection is sorted by its natural order.

functions.shortDoc: a new collection with the same elements as the original, sorted

functions.name: average

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

numeric collection to get the average from

functions.shortDoc: the average of all elements in the collection. If an element is not numeric it is ignored.

functions.name: getat

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to get the element from

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: index of the element to get (starting at 1)

parameters.name: orelse
parameters.description:
• Optional
  • Likely named

value to return if the index is out of bounds. If unset, false is returned.

functions.shortDoc: element at the given index, or NOT_FOUND if the index is out of bounds

functions.name: sumall

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

numeric collection to sum

functions.shortDoc: the sum of all elements in the collection. If an element is not numeric it is ignored.

functions.name: groupvalues

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to group

functions.shortDoc: Groups a collection by their value.

functions.name: reversed

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to reverse

functions.shortDoc: a new collection with the same elements as the original, in reverse order

functions.name: third

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to get the third element from

functions.shortDoc: third element of the collection, or NOT_FOUND if the collection has less than 3 elements

functions.name: first

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
• Likely named

collection to get the first element from

functions.shortDoc: first element of the collection, or NOT_FOUND if the collection is empty

functions.name: pair

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: first element of the pair

parameters.name: second
parameters.description: second element of the pair

functions.shortDoc: Creates a new pair.
